newsitem.title: JAPAN: INSIGHT - JGBs seen drifting down, await ouput data.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - JGBs seen drifting down, await ouput data.

text.p: The key June 10-year Japanese government bond futures contract is expected to test the downside on Thursday, retaining weakness from LIFFE overnight.
The market will be closely watching industrial output data for April and forecasts for May and June, due at 1.30 p.m. (0430 GMT), traders said.
The primary focus will be on the forecast for production in June, which is expected to come in at around minus one, said a trader for a trust bank's securities unit.
If the forecast for June is substantially stronger, JGBs are likely to be sold, the trader said.

The market's view of the economy is based on expectations of a slowdown in the April-June quarter due to the effects of the consumption tax rise, and a strong forecast for output in June may force the market to revise its thinking, the trader said.
Economists polled by Reuters forecast rises in industrial output for April ranging from 0.3 percent to 1.5 percent, compared with a month-on-month drop of 0.3 percent in March.
The market has already factored in a slight increase in output in April and a positive forecast for output in May, the trader for a trust bank's securities unit said.
Lack of buying by investors has contributed to recent falls in the JGB market, a trader for a long-term credit bank said.
Investors have refrained from buying JGBs recently as they are not yet sure when the fall in JGBs will abate, he said.
The BOJ said late on Wednesday that it would release the results of its next "tankan" corporate sentiment survey on June 25, rather than in early July.
A BOJ spokesman said the decision to release the tankan earlier than previously planned did not indicate a change in the central bank's monetary policy.
